summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Washington Street, from Third Avenue South to Fourth Avenue South, all in the City of Seattle by paving the same with sandstone blocks, laid upon a proper concrete foundation, with granite curbs, brick gutters and all necessary water mains, with appurtenances, in accordance with Resolution No. 111 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
